author: AFP
title: Two South Koreans abducted in Nigeria released : Seoul
text:
Two South Koreans have been released after being abducted nearly three weeks ago by an unidentified armed group in Nigeria, the foreign ministry in Seoul said Saturday. Kidnapping for ransom is common in Nigeria and foreign workers have been targeted in the past by criminal gangs, especially those working in remote mining or construction projects.
The two Koreans, who were abducted in southern Nigeria on December 12, are employees of Daewoo Engineering & Construction Co., a major South Korean builder, according to Seoul's Yonhap news agency.
South Korean authorities secured their custody on Friday, Seoul's foreign ministry said, further stating that they are in good health.
The men "have been moved to a safe area after a medical examination, and have spoken to their families" via phone, the ministry said in a statement sent to AFP.
The foreign ministry said their release was secured thanks to "close cooperation" between the government in Seoul and the company, and through "collaboration" with Nigerian military, police and intelligence authorities.
It did not state if any ransom was paid.
During the abduction incident, members of the armed group killed four bodyguards, who are Nigerian soldiers, as well as two local drivers, Seoul said in the statement.
The South Korean government vowed to "continue to review the measures for the protection" of its nationals in Nigeria.
Seoul will "actively engage with relevant government agencies, businesses, and overseas Koreans to prevent kidnapping incidents," it added.
Several Asian companies including from China and South Korea operate in Nigeria and are often involved with the country's road and railway construction projects.

author: Agencias
title: Koldo pidi√≥ a la ex presidenta de Adif que fichara a la ex novia de √Åbalos en Ineco: "Si no Jos√© me corta los huevos"
text:
Koldo pidi√≥ a la ex presidenta de Adif que fichara a la ex novia de √Åbalos en Ineco: "Si no Jos√© me corta los huevos"
La UCO dice que el ex asesor "se prevali√≥ de su relaci√≥n" con el ex ministro para que Isabel Pardo de Vera la contratara
La UCO cree que Air Europa alquil√≥ una casa para √Åbalos como "contraprestaci√≥n" por el rescate
Madrid/La Unidad Central Operativa (UCO) de la Guardia Civil ha asegurado en un nuevo informe que el ex asesor Koldo Garc√≠a "se prevali√≥ de su relaci√≥n" con el ex ministro Jos√© Luis √Åbalos para que la entonces presidenta de Adif, Isabel Pardo de Vera, hiciera efectiva la contrataci√≥n de JRG, ex pareja de √Åbalos, en la empresa p√∫blica Ineco. Los agentes recogen el mensaje: "Solo una cosa que llamen a la chica para que inicie los tr√°mites para la contrataci√≥n como administrativa de yoseba que sino jose me corta los huevos" (sic).
En el informe, la Benem√©rita precisa que Koldo Garc√≠a envi√≥ el mensaje a Pardo de Vera el 11 de febrero de 2019 y considera que su contenido, "unido al cargo p√∫blico ocupado tanto por su emisor como destinatario", es "revelador" porque en esa fecha ella era presidenta de Adif, que forma parte del "√≥rgano rector y deliberante de Ineco".
"En la petici√≥n de Koldo a Isabel queda reflejado que Koldo se ampara en √Åbalos para consolidar as√≠ la fuerza y validez de sus peticiones", a√±ade. Seg√∫n la UCO, cuando la presidenta de Adif recibe el mensaje "desconoce qui√©n es 'la chica'" a la que se hace referencia, "por lo que le solicita que en formato papel le remita sus datos a la oficina".
La Guardia Civil apunta tambi√©n que "pasados unos d√≠as de ese mensaje" Garc√≠a le consult√≥ a Pardo de Vera si ten√≠a alguna novedad sobre el contrato de JRG. En el atestado consta que ella respondi√≥: "Est√°n ya con ello, ma√±ana le llaman, no se puede dar de alta sin seguir un procedimiento".
Seg√∫n los agentes, la ex pareja de √Åbalos avis√≥ al entonces asesor ministerial de que no la hab√≠an llamado todav√≠a. As√≠ las cosas, Garc√≠a envi√≥ otro mensaje a Pardo de Vera, "quien le inform√≥ de que terceras personas hab√≠an tratado de contactar con ella a lo largo de la ma√±ana".
La UCO asegura que Koldo Garc√≠a "comparti√≥" el contacto de JRG a la presidenta de Adif. "Casi cuatro horas m√°s tarde, JRG le confirm√≥ a Koldo que acababa de recibir esa llamada", se√±ala. La que fuera novia de √Åbalos precis√≥: "Pero es para una entrevista".
"Y se lo dices a Jos√© y que llame a quien tenga que llamar"
La Guardia Civil considera que dicha "aclaraci√≥n" parece indicar que "no contaban con tener que realizar un proceso de selecci√≥n". "De hecho, Koldo le indic√≥ a JRG que no acudiera", se√±alan los agentes.
En los mensajes intervenidos consta que Koldo le dijo: "Me encargo yo". La UCO recalca adem√°s que el exasesor afirm√≥ que la acompa√±ar√≠a a la evaluaci√≥n y que "sobre √©l reca√≠a cualquier tr√°mite a realizarse con esa empresa p√∫blica".
JRG incidi√≥ en que llevaba un mes esperando a ser contratada. "Oye, y si se lo dices a Jose y que llame a quien tenga q llamar (...) Si es tan sencillo que √©l haga una llamada, seguro que si es por m√≠ la hace encantado", le dijo la novia de √Åbalos a Koldo, quien asegur√≥ que transmitir√≠a el mensaje al entonces ministro.
Seg√∫n la UCO, tras esa conversaci√≥n Garc√≠a inform√≥ a la presidenta de Adif que √©l y JRG acudir√≠an a las 16.50 horas, en vez de a las 15.30 como desde 'Ineco - Reclutamiento' se hab√≠a convenido en el correo electr√≥nico enviado a JRG. Pardo de Vera le contest√≥: "Est√° confirmado ok".
"Igualmente, el hecho de que poco tiempo despu√©s JRG le comunicara a Koldo que hab√≠a recibido una llamada de personal de Ineco notific√°ndole la modificaci√≥n del horario y lugar de reuni√≥n indicaba que la petici√≥n de Koldo fue transmitida y ejecutada", subrayan los agentes. De los mensajes intervenidos, la Benem√©rita deduce que la entrevista finalmente no se celebr√≥ ese d√≠a, sino el d√≠a siguiente.
El mensaje a Pardo de Vera: "Te va a llamar Jos√©"
Los investigadores destacan tambi√©n que Garc√≠a lleg√≥ a enviar un mensaje a la presidenta de Adif en el que le dec√≠a: "Por cierto, te va a llamar Jose (...) As√≠ que tranquila".
La UCO recuerda que la contrataci√≥n de JRG en Ineco se formaliz√≥ e informa al Supremo de que Pardo de Vera "tambi√©n particip√≥ en la renovaci√≥n de su contrato". Los agentes hacen referencia a un mensaje del 12 de noviembre de 2020 en el que, "ante la vicisitud de la renovaci√≥n", la presidenta de la empresa ferroviaria le coment√≥ a Garc√≠a que estaba pendiente: "(...) Ya toca revisi√≥n de su contrato, lo habl√≥ contigo?".
En el informe consta que el exasesor de √Åbalos le contest√≥: "S√≠, s√≠, lo hablamos t√∫ y yo". Para la Guardia Civil, esto evidencia que "este asunto lo abordaban conjuntamente" Pardo de Vera y Garc√≠a.
Propuesta para continuar en Tragsatec
El 17 de noviembre de 2020, JRG pregunt√≥ a Garc√≠a sobre la extensi√≥n de su contrato. √âl se limit√≥ a responderle "Febrero". No obstante, los agentes subrayan que Pardo de Vera avis√≥ d√≠as despu√©s al asesor del Ministerio de Transportes de que la renovaci√≥n parec√≠a no ser viable.
"Isabel inform√≥ a Koldo de que Ignacio Zald√≠var Garc√≠a, en ese momento director de gesti√≥n administrativa de la empresa Adif, hab√≠a hablado con JRG y 'le hab√≠a dejado entrever que es muy dif√≠cil encajarla en alg√∫n sitio'", recoge el informe.
Seg√∫n los agentes, Zald√≠var luego le envi√≥ un correo electr√≥nico en el que "le comunic√≥ la propuesta de continuar en la empresa p√∫blica Tragsatec durante seis meses". JRG firm√≥ con dicha compa√±√≠a el 2 de marzo de 2021.
La UCO apunta que el presidente de Tragsa, Jes√∫s Casas, dijo ante la comisi√≥n de investigaci√≥n del Senado sobre el 'caso Koldo' que la contrataci√≥n respond√≠a a "un encargo a medio propio de Adif".
"Ya no hace falta vayas m√°s"
En el informe, la Guardia Civil incide tambi√©n en que, seg√∫n los mensajes intervenidos, "JRG no habr√≠a asistido a su puesto de trabajo en Ineco" por intermediaci√≥n de Garc√≠a. Los agentes se√±alan que Koldo le dijo a la novia de √Åbalos que tras un primer encuentro no ten√≠a que volver a acudir a su puesto de trabajo: "Contesta al correo, dile que el martes vuelves de viaje (...) Y nos pasamos y ya no hace falta que vallas m√°s" (sic).
La UCO apunta adem√°s que JRG intent√≥ hacer uso de la tarjeta de comida que ofrece Ineco a sus trabajadores. "(...) Seguro q la tarjeta estar√° en alg√∫n sobre donde hayamos puesto que trabajo", dijo la joven a Garc√≠a para luego a√±adir: "Dame una direcci√≥n y un tel√©fono porq no s√© d√≥nde trabajo".
El entonces asesor de √Åbalos le indic√≥ que pusiera la direcci√≥n de trabajo de Joseba Garc√≠a, su hermano y jefe la joven en Ineco, quien "contribuy√≥ a ocultar que JRG no comparec√≠a a su puesto de trabajo".
De las conversaciones analizadas, los agentes tambi√©n concluyen que Joseba Garc√≠a "se encarg√≥ de cumplimentar los partes de trabajo mensuales de JRG" y que ambos se "coordinaban" para que ella "registrara cada d√≠a una jornada laboral que no hab√≠a sido realizada".
Seg√∫n la Guardia Civil, JRG asegur√≥ que no le preocupaba lo que pudiese suceder con su trabajo en Ineco y que, en todo caso, les deber√≠a preocupar a Koldo y Joseba. Los agentes aseguran que la joven tampoco acudi√≥ a su puesto de trabajo en Tragsatec.
En el marco del informe, la UCO insiste en que las evidencias intervenidas en la causa permiten apuntar tambi√©n a "la existencia de un v√≠nculo de car√°cter econ√≥mico entre (el empresario investigado V√≠ctor de) Aldama y √Åbalos, sustentado en el pago del alquiler de una vivienda de JRG".
Para los agentes, el pago mensual del piso de Plaza Espa√±a, en Madrid, ser√≠a una "contraprestaci√≥n econ√≥mica" al exministro de Transportes.

author: Punahou School
title: Writing for Change: Letters of Gratitude to Mother Earth - Punahou School
text:
In this season of gratitude, one student is finding a way to inspire hope and healing for both people and the planet. Mari Dela Cruz ‚Äô26 has combined her love for Hawai ªi‚Äôs  ªƒÅina and her passion for mental wellbeing into a project that encourages gratitude, fosters awareness, and takes action to address climate change.
With events such as the recent Maui wildfires in Lahaina to the hurricanes causing great damage to the Southeastern United States, students are keenly aware that climate change is quickly becoming more harmful to the lives of many on these islands, in the nation, and the world. Dela Cruz said, ‚ÄúThe damage that climate change could continue to cause is a frightening thought, making it easy to understand why many individuals around the world are experiencing ‚Äòclimate anxiety‚Äô ‚Äì fears around what the future of a warming planet could bring to the table.‚Äù
Dela Cruz is combating this problem through her ‚ÄúAloha ƒÄina Ambassadors ‚Äù initiative. Through this project, she hopes to improve the mental health and emotional wellbeing of the younger generation of Hawai‚Äòi while increasing awareness and taking action on the climate change issue by instilling and encouraging gratitude and acts of aloha towards our  ªƒÅina.
With guidance from Yolanda Lau ‚Äò98, director of the Case Accelerator for Student Entrepreneurship (CASE), Dela Cruz began researching the positive effects expressing gratitude can have on the mental wellbeing of the daily lives of people. Lau coached Dela Cruz to use generative artificial intelligence to brainstorm project ideas that combined Dela Cruz‚Äôs own interests, ideas and goals and then to iterate with the AI to refine the ideas. Ultimately, Dela Cruz developed a unique project that reflects her passions and personality.
Dela Cruz‚Äôs project aims to work with students to write gratitude letters to ‚ÄúMother Earth,‚Äù in which students could write and draw about one thing they love about planet Earth, and then write one thing they pledged to do to take care of the environmental thing they listed. She hopes that through this, students can become more aware of how beautiful the land is and how lucky we are to live here in Hawai ªi, help to improve improve overall mental wellbeing of students surrounding climate change through writing with gratitude, and instill a core belief in students to realize that they truly could make a difference in the environment and preserve it for future generations.
Recently, she worked with 48 fifth graders in Stephanie Lum Yee (who was one of Dela Cruz‚Äôs elementary school teachers) and Jan Murakami ‚Äò86 Furuta‚Äôs joint class to teach them about the importance of gratitude. She had each student write their own letters to the environment. Students enjoyed writing about their love for the beaches, mountains to hike on, and plants that help give them air to breathe.
Dela Cruz hopes to showcase the letters of these students to the Punahou, Hawai ªi and global community to serve as a beacon of hope that others can look at to get the same impact the students got out of writing these leaders: an appreciation and sense of k≈´leana to take care of the ‚ÄòƒÅina.
Lum Yee said, ‚ÄúIt was wonderful to see a former student continue to work diligently and advocate for meaningful issues while also inspiring the next generation of learners. Having the opportunity to work on this project with my students was an incredibly rewarding experience. What I found particularly powerful was how the project combined elements of mindfulness, cultural appreciation and environmental stewardship in a way that felt very personal and accessible to the students. It gave them a chance to slow down and reflect, something that many of them don‚Äôt often have time to do in their busy lives. It also sparked thoughtful conversations about sustainability and the importance of taking care of the land for future generations. The focus on gratitude, connection to the land and emotional well-being created a powerful space for students to reflect on their own lives and the environment they are so fortunate to be a part of.‚Äù
Dela Cruz‚Äôs project was launched through the recently reestablished Project Accelerator, a program of the CASE with Lau. The Project Accelerator was originally designed as a summer school course, which debuted in 2023. For 2024 ‚Äì 2025, Lau redeveloped it into a program to provide high-quality support and guidance to all our budding entrepreneurs while fostering a collaborative community of like-minded students. The Project Accelerator emphasizes a triple-bottom-line mindset, considering people, planet and profit in all entrepreneurial endeavors ‚Äì including for-profit ventures as well as nonprofit initiatives like Dela Cruz‚Äôs.
Dela Cruz shared, ‚ÄúThe Project Accelerator provided me with invaluable advice and guidance to help me turn my many ideas into a reality, and allow me to create an impactful solution to give back to Hawai ªi and instill a sense of hope in this generation that we truly can create a healthier planet and future.‚Äù
Her project was also recently accepted into the 2024 ‚Äì 2025 Hawai ªi Youth Sustainability Challenge with KUPU and K≈çkua Hawai ªi Foundation, which provides funding and guidance for students working to create projects to conserve the environment of Hawai ªi and increase sustainability awareness. She hopes to use this program to expand her project outside of Punahou, and make more impact in Hawai ªi and beyond.
Lau, who also taught Dela Cruz in a fourth and fifth grade robotics course years before mentoring her through CASE, said, ‚ÄúI feel honored to work with innovative and thoughtful student entrepreneurs like Mari. The next generation holds the key to both hope and healing in the face of climate change ‚Äì and a world of uncertainty and rapid change. Watching Mari grow from a curious fifth grader to a passionate leader fills me with pride and confidence for our collective future. Mari‚Äôs journey embodies the values of compassion, creativity, kuleana and leadership that we aim to nurture in all our students.‚Äù

author: Juliana Monferr√°n
title: El ESTUDIO CIENT√çFICO que descubri√≥ c√≥mo saber el ESTADO de nuestro CEREBRO y c√≥mo ENVEJECE - El Cronista
text:
Un estudio reciente publicado en el Journal of Clinical Investigation descubri√≥ c√≥mo conocer el estado de nuestro cerebro y entender c√≥mo envejeci√≥.
La investigaci√≥n asegura que la actividad disminuida de se√±ales nerviosas en los vasos sangu√≠neos del cerebro se ha relacionado con un declive de la funci√≥n vascular .
"Una parte esencial del estudio es que sienta las bases para obtener informaci√≥n relacionada con el envejecimiento psicol√≥gico en ausencia de otras patolog√≠as como pueden ser la demencia, el alzh√©imer o el p√°rkinson", asegura la autora principal del estudio, la doctora Luisa Iruela Arispe .
Un estudio investig√≥ acerca del envejecimiento del cerebro. (Fuente: Pixabay) Es el mejor pa√≠s del mundo para vivir despu√©s de jubilarse y es muy f√°cil conseguir la visa para emigrar
El ritual de la cajita de la abundancia que se hace el 31 de diciembre para atraer prosperidad
Salud: ¬øc√≥mo se realiz√≥ el estudio que descubri√≥ c√≥mo saber el estado de nuestro cerebro? Para realizar el estudio , los cient√≠ficos implantaron en ratones vasos sangu√≠neos cerebrales de personas j√≥venes y sanas , y estudiaron el declive de las v√≠as de se√±alizaci√≥n Notch3 que ten√≠an lugar en el cerebro de los animales.
Despu√©s de hacer pruebas de resonancia y an√°lisis de sangre, tanto de las personas como de los ratones, se descubri√≥ que la reducci√≥n de esta v√≠a de se√±alizaci√≥n neuronal era capaz de alterar la regulaci√≥n de los niveles de calcio .
La investigaci√≥n sobre el cerebro fue publicada por el Journal of Clinical Investigation . (Fuente: Pixabay)
Mejorar la memoria: 13 adivinanzas que funcionan para ejercitar la mente
El ritual con arroz y agua que hay que hacer antes del A√±o Nuevo Chino 2024 para atraer la energ√≠a positiva
Esto provocaba que los vasos sangu√≠neos tuvieran cada vez m√°s dificultad para contraerse efectivamente , lo que conllevar√≠a problemas como la incapacidad de dilataci√≥n o los microaneurismas.
Adem√°s, se mostr√≥ que esta reducci√≥n del Notch3 no afecta solamente al sistema vascular, sino tambi√©n al linf√°tico , debido a que su flujo se vio tambi√©n disminuido.
Los investigadores aseguran que en el futuro m√°s que cercano podremos evaluar exactamente el avance del envejecimiento neuronal y de determinadas enfermedades que atacan al cerebro.

author: Luis Villaescusa
title: El Real Madrid bate el r√©cord de victorias en una primera vuelta de Euroliga: 16-1 | Baloncesto | Deportes | EL PA√çS
text:
Euroliga jornada 17 Asvel Villeurbanne 76 77 Finalizado Real Madrid El Real Madrid baj√≥ el tel√≥n de 2023 en la Euroliga con un registro para la historia: por primera vez desde que est√° instaurado el formato actual, un equipo ha ganado 16 de los primeros 17 partidos de la fase regular, logrando una primera vuelta casi impoluta . El conjunto de Chus Mateo, vigente campe√≥n y apabullante l√≠der de la Euroliga, sufri√≥ m√°s de la cuenta para superar al ASVEL Villeurbanne (76-77), colista de la competici√≥n que, con un balance de dos victorias y 15 derrotas, se convierte en el peor equipo en una primera vuelta de Euroliga.
Sobre el papel, el duelo estaba tremendamente desequilibrado. Pero lo cierto es que el Madrid tuvo que sudar la camiseta para sacar adelante la victoria. Los blancos, que viajaron a Villeurbanne sin Hezonja (gripe), Rudy (descanso), Deck (lesi√≥n muscular) y Yabusele (lesi√≥n de rodilla), salieron a la cancha remolones y, sobre todo, fallones. En cinco minutos, el ASVEL abri√≥ la primera grieta (13-4) mientras hac√≠a sufrir al Madrid en la pintura con un gigante de 2,21 llamado Youssoupha Fall. Tavares se las tuvo tiesas con el ex de Baskonia y Chus Mateo lo mand√≥ al banco para dar entrada a Poirier, que cumpli√≥ 200 partidos con el equipo blanco. El franc√©s espabil√≥ a los suyos, que lograron reducir la distancia a un punto al final del primer cuarto (19-18), pero los malos porcentajes de tiro condenaban el intento de remontada blanca. Al descanso, el Madrid promediaba un 47% de tiros de campo, con un 27% en triples. Con un poco m√°s de punter√≠a, el ASVEL manten√≠a a raya al l√≠der de la Euroliga. Solo un triple marca de la casa de Llull a dos segundos del descanso impidi√≥ que el Madrid se fuera 9 abajo (39-33).
ùëµùíê ùíâùíÇùíö ùíàùíçùíêùíìùíäùíÇ ùíîùíäùíè ùíîùíñùíáùíìùíäùíéùíäùíÜùíèùíïùíê...
El Real Madrid cierra la mejor primera vuelta de la historia de Euroleague con un ajustado triunfo ante el ASVEL Lyon-Villeurbanne. (76-77) #Eurofighters pic.twitter.com/T4lmQUKAGt
‚Äî Basket en Movistar Plus+ (@MovistarBasket) December 28, 2023 Ante la cantidad de bajas en el puesto de cuatro, Chus Mateo confi√≥ en el joven Ndiaje, pero el canterano no tuvo su mejor d√≠a (0 puntos, 0 asistencias, un rebote y una p√©rdida). El t√©cnico, viendo que su equipo no terminaba de reaccionar, decidi√≥ meter a las dos torres, Tavares y Poirier mano a mano ante Fall, que mantuvo un intenso duelo hasta que cometi√≥ la cuarta falta y Pozzecco decidi√≥ reservarle.
El Madrid, sin finura, se manten√≠a en el partido a remolque (57-51 al final del tercer cuarto). Pero cuando lleg√≥ el momento de la verdad, el Madrid volvi√≥ a ser el Madrid. Los blancos salieron al √∫ltimo cuarto como si llevaran todo el partido esperando el momento para acelerar y llevarse por delante a su rival. 16-0 de parcial de salida, con 8 puntos de Poirier (17 al final) y dejando al ASVEL casi seis minutos sin anotar. El mazazo dej√≥ groguis a los locales, que despu√©s de dominar pr√°cticamente todo el duelo, ve√≠an con impotencia c√≥mo se les negaba la victoria (57-65). Pero el orgullo y el acierto de Luwawu-Cabarrot (20 puntos, 10 en el √∫ltimo cuarto) devolvi√≥ el partido a la arena (74-74) en el √∫ltimo minuto. Al Madrid no le tembl√≥ el pulso y solvent√≥ la faena desde el tiro libre y con una buena defensa.
La victoria, aunque sufrida, redonde√≥ una primera vuelta europea casi perfecta para el Madrid. El domingo, en casa ante el Valencia (12.00, Movistar), despedir√°n el a√±o como el equipo m√°s en forma de Europa.
Valencia y Baskonia pinchan a domicilio Los otros dos equipos espa√±oles que jugaban Euroliga no tuvieron la misma suerte que el Real Madrid. El Valencia, pr√≥ximo rival de los blancos, cay√≥ en su visita a M√∫nich ante el Bayern de Pablo Laso (85-84) en un partido vibrante e igualado. Los de Mumbr√∫ ten√≠an en su mano igualar la mejor primera vuelta en Euroliga de la historia del club y dejaron todo en la cancha, pero les falt√≥ fortuna en el momento decisivo y L√≥pez-Arostegui no acert√≥ el √∫ltimo lanzamiento. Por otro lado, el Baskonia tuvo una noche gris en su visita al Armani Mil√°n (76-67) . El cuadro italiano domin√≥ desde el primer momento a los de Ivanovic, negados en el tiro exterior con un 3 de 16 (18%). El s√°bado, ante el Girona, intentar√°n despedir el a√±o con un mejor sabor de boca.
Arrollador Voigtmann.
Apisonadora Olimpia Milano.
Los de Dusko Ivanovic cierran con derrota la primera vuelta de Euroleague tras caer en Mil√°n. (76-67) #Eurofighters pic.twitter.com/uCWuNWzGav
‚Äî Basket en Movistar Plus+ (@MovistarBasket) December 28, 2023 Puedes seguir a EL PA√çS Deportes en Facebook y X , o apuntarte aqu√≠ para recibir nuestra newsletter semanal .

author: OpIndia Staff
title: Violence in Pakistan: Mob tortures man, goes on rampage over alleged desecration of Quran in Sargodha
text:
On the morning of 25th May, a vengeful crowd in the Mujahid Colony area of Sargodha in Pakistan attacked and vandalized a man‚Äôs house in retaliation for an alleged blasphemy incident. Angry individuals broke into the man‚Äôs home, trashed his possessions and set fire to the shoe factory that was located there. Furthermore, they destroyed nearby electrical installations and set fire to tyres. However, the situation began to calm down after the Regional Police Officer (RPO), Sargodha District Police Officer (DPO) and a significant police contingent arrived at the scene. Two families from the Christian community were also rescued from the rabid throng by the authorities.
Another Jaranwala style attack on Christians in Sargodha with mob attacking local community, burning and ransacking property. The failure of the State to take any serious and sincere action against perpetrators of the Jaranwala incident has only emboldened those who exploit‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/ks7uTziYaX
‚Äî M. Jibran Nasir (@MJibranNasir) May 25, 2024 The police transported the injured victim and other wounded persons to a hospital in an ambulance before apprehending multiple culprits. The extremists also used stones to attack the police party, according to RPO Shariq Kamal, but they were eventually driven out. He declared that those who disrupted law and order would face harsh consequences and that the incident was under investigation. The Human Rights Commission of Pakistan (HRCP) voiced concerns about the situation in Sargodha and urged the district government and Punjab Police to quickly restore order and prosecute those responsible.
HRCP is seriously concerned by the unfolding situation in #Sargodha , where the Christian community in Gillwala village is reportedly at grave risk to their lives at the hands of charged mobs. There are unconfirmed reports of a man having been allegedly lynched.
The Punjab‚Ä¶
‚Äî Human Rights Commission of Pakistan (@HRCP87) May 25, 2024 Officials said that the vandalism was carried out by unidentified individuals after the discovery of burnt pages of the Quran which triggered the violent reaction. Asad Ejaz Malhi, the Sargodha DPO also confirmed that the disturbance was caused by suspected desecration of the Quran, but he insisted that a sizable police presence was present and no casualties were reported. ‚ÄúWhen police arrived, the mob had gathered outside the houses. Officers cordoned off the area and safely evacuated all residents. The police peacefully dispersed the crowd,‚Äù he stated and added, ‚ÄúAdditional police units were stationed throughout the city to ensure the safety of the Christian community.‚Äù
Unconfirmed social media footage showed many people including youngsters destroying furniture while a crowd surrounded a man who was covered in blood. A large fire outside a house was captured on another video. However, Malhi alleged that no one was hurt and dismissed them as ‚Äúfake videos‚Äù and he argued, ‚ÄúThe police are maintaining law and order.‚Äù His claim was refuted by a family member of a wounded person who revealed that his uncle was in severe condition at a local hospital.
Malhi stated that the suspect was in jail and an investigation was ongoing, but he was unable to verify whether the claimed desecration had actually taken place. A resident of Sargodha named Mohsin Malhi reported that the suspect set fire to two of his homes and a factory. A district peace committee made up of representatives from the Muslim and minority communities as well as religious scholars would assess the situation and make a statement, according to Malhi. A declaration from the Christian community is also anticipated.
The instance brought up memories of a similar attack that happened in Jaranwala in August of last year when Islamists torched numerous homes and churches as they rampaged through a neighbourhood that was predominately Christian over blasphemy charges.

author: UK News
title: It is ‚Äòunbelievable‚Äô to receive British Empire Medal, says fundraising teenager
text:
It is ‚Äòunbelievable‚Äô to receive British Empire Medal, says fundraising teenager
Louis Johnson has been awarded the gong for services to the community in Wolverhampton.
A teenager who has raised about ¬£75,000 for 18 charities said it feels ‚Äúunbelievable‚Äù to be awarded a British Empire Medal (BEM) in the New Year Honours list.
Louis Johnson, 17, has been fundraising for a range of good causes in Wolverhampton, his home town, since he was 11 and has received his medal for services to his community.
He personally raised ¬£20,000 for Birmingham Children‚Äôs Hospital and has received numerous awards for his fundraising efforts, including the Midlands Air Ambulance young fundraiser of the year title in 2017.
He told the PA news agency: ‚ÄúI couldn‚Äôt believe it, I really couldn‚Äôt. It set in once I saw the letters and the emails and stuff and it‚Äôs just unbelievable.
‚ÄúIt all started when I was very, very little doing Barnardo‚Äôs walks with my mum that she used to set up and then it‚Äôs just expanded from there, from me wanting to do the annual memory walks for a hospice that my nan was in, to going to 18 different charities and raising about ¬£75,000 in total.
‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt think I‚Äôd be where I am at at the moment. I‚Äôve from a young age been doing my fundraising but over the years it‚Äôs exploded, it‚Äôs got bigger and bigger, more money and, yeah.‚Äù
On how his friends will react to his BEM, he said: ‚ÄúI think they‚Äôll be proud of me, they know what I do and they are supportive of it.‚Äù
In the year ahead, he said he plans to continue fundraising, ‚Äúraising more money, making a bigger difference‚Äù.

author: Olumide Adesina
title: Microsoft (MSFT) Crushes Q4 Expectations, Shares Soar 10% on AI-Driven Cloud Boom
text: Microsoft (MSFT) released an impressive fiscal fourth-quarter report for 2025 that significantly surpassed Wall Street's expectations, resulting in a more than 7% increase in shares during after-hours trading. The strong growth of Azure and the adoption of enterprise solutions outweighed concerns about rising capital expenditures, further solidifying Microsoft's position as the leader in the hyperscale cloud market during the AI era. Investors had anticipated considerable expenses related to AI infrastructure, but management's performance in the productivity and cloud segments mitigated those concerns, at least for now. Investors were primarily worried about whether Azure could maintain growth between 30% and 40%, how the company would present its $80 billion capital expenditure outlook for fiscal 2025, and whether its partnership with OpenAI would continue to provide a competitive advantage against the increasing pressure from Google Cloud. According to data released on Wednesday, Microsoft not only met but exceeded even the highest projections, particularly in Azure, which experienced a 39% increase in constant currency, compared to consensus estimates of around 34%. Microsoft joins Nvidia, a chipmaker that recently became the first company to reach a market capitalization of $4 trillion The Azure cloud computing division was a key driver behind Microsoft's 18% revenue growth, marking its fastest expansion rate in over three years. For the first time, Microsoft disclosed Azure revenue in U.S. dollars, reporting sales of Azure and other cloud services exceeding $75 billion in fiscal 2025, a 34% increase from the previous year. Microsoft's stock had risen 22% for the year, outpacing the S&P 500's 8% gain. On July 25, Microsoft closed at a record price of $513.71, and in after-hours trading, it was valued at over $553. Nvidia and Microsoft have now surpassed Apple in terms of market capitalization. Investor concerns about Apple's ability to compete in AI have caused the iPhone manufacturer's stock to drop 17% this year, placing it in third position at about $3.2 trillion. Apple is set to release its quarterly results following the bell on Thursday.
